radiographic_examinations.findings: Subendocardial resting perfusion defect and a small region of delayed hypoenhancement along the inferior wall, indicative of myocardial infarction.
3 mm of ST-segment elevation in leads II, III, and aVF and 1 mm of ST-segment elevation in leads V5 to V6.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Partial resolution of the ST-segment elevations was noted on repeated ECG.
